Hi Liz,

Before we start work on the front end we would like to get sign off on both the visual designs mock-ups and where we place them.

http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/254

In terms of design/placement we have three options:

- Option 1 (in context / near content) 

Putting the share widget close to the actual content we want the user to share ie. under the title/sidebar. This would involve more work than agreed as we'd need to align the widget to every type of content we have.

No screen shot as we don't think this is a practical route atm  but hopefully you can imagine what we are talking about.

- Option 2 (footer)

Putting the share widget on the bottom of the page as per the original design (although this was only supplied in a closed / single icon state)

This can be put to everywhere (as every page has a footer). However it's on a blindspot location, one needs to scroll to the very bottom of the page to find it. 

The attached screen has two states i) is if the 'share this page' text is clicked on the second ii) is if the 'email a friend' link is selected (the default closed stare isn't shown, but is just the icon and text on the bar)



- Option 3 (a new tab in global navigation)

This involves an additional menu item in the top menu. Works the same as the other drop down menu items, so no additional learning curve for the user to use the feature. Slightly changed tab color indicates it's
a bit different functionality than the actual menu, and draws the attention to it. The drop down menu give us more scope to fit in functionality to tie in with to socials networks (ie. an invite your friends functionality later on). 

The attached screen has two states i) one is the standard closed state the second ii) is the 'email a friend' box



Both options 1 and 2 have a similar implementation costs so it's really down to which one you think has the most benefit / least impact on key elements of the design.

I'm personally leaning towards 3, but need to make sure you are happy with spacing once the shop tab is reinstated as it woudl fill the top bar.

If you happy progressing on either can you just add a comment to that effect on the ticket itself if you'd like to discuss further feel free to call me.
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/254

Jamie
Option 2, take 1 here: http://london2012dev.kitsite.com/ - Liz, I'm not sure you have access to this one. If not, I'm sure Jamie will give screenshots / access in due time.

subject: Quick report on how many have changed their passwords

comments.value: Kieran, can you tell us how many people / percentage of UMS have actually changed their passwords so far?
Follow up from http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/439. I have set it to priority 'high'.

It's difficult to say precisely.
Of people who registered BEFORE the password reset exercise, 1100 now have a strong password. i.e. they came back to the site, realized they couldn't login any more, and successfully reset their password.
SINCE that date (Feb 24), 10,300 users have registered, and managed to assign themselves a strong password.


(The reason I said "It's difficult to say precisely" is because some of the 1100 will be people who weren't /returning/ to the site, but were registering for the first time).

That sounds very satisfactory Kieran - thanks for updating.

In all of my experiments, in FF & IE7, the alt text does appear in the published pages in these situations.

Currently, when you edit a Blog post, if you include an image inline, then that image's alt-text is displayed in the editor; you can leave it, if you're happy with it, or you can amend it - your amended alt-text only appears on this page though.

When you edit a page using the regular Page editor, if you upload an image into a picture container, then the alt text is NOT auto-populated for you. You /can/ still insert your own custom alt text. If you enter nothing, though, then the image gets rendered with whatever alt text was specified when it was uploaded. (*1) In fact, if open the page again in the page editor, the image's alt text appears as you might expect.

I'm not sure which of the above is the intended/prefered behaviour.

I haven't observed any problem whereby alt text is actually /lost/.
There /is/ an argument for auto-populating the alt-text control in the (regular) page editor (*2), to make what is going on more obvious. Expecially given that this is how the Blog editor works and also because of (*1).

Am forwarding to Janos.
Janos, does this change (*2) look possible?


NB I am generating a list of pages/assets that currently have no alt text. However, I don't think that such pages/assets are related to this ticket.

subject: New navigation not showing "Work for LOCOG" section

comments.value: The section navigation in "Work for LOCOG" http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/index.php is not showing the link to http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/get-ahead-school-leavers-programme/index.php.

This is because the navigation on the top left-hand side of the page (i.e. above News, Blog, etc.) is not created statically, so that after creating a new section you will need to republish all the existing page, in this case all the pages inside "Work for LOCOG". I have republished them and they should all look fine now.

When I said the navigation "is not created statically", I actually meant "is not created dynamically", i.e. it is static content. Oops! 

Marking this ticket as solved.

subject: PostCMS technical spec for Gianfranco

comments.value: This is an outstanding request from Morag dating back from August. If we have anything to hand (from an old pitch document, perhaps), that would be a very helpful start.

Don't think I was in the loop on that earlier request. This isn't my bag though - I imagine it would mostly be K, with some help from J. So I'm reassigning it. But even if it's chargeable as you suggest, it seems a bit unlikely theywill be able to prioritize over other work any time soon.
Ticket #59 "Technical specification" was closed and merged into this ticket.

I have spoken to Gianfranco and he has the following requests for this piece of work.

We are still working on the exact definition of what we will demand of all our suppliers in the next future, but the general list of technical documents will look like the following:

1)       the solution architecture of the service 

2)       its deployment (e.g description of current instance, general principles for future deployments, firewall requirements, load balancing capabilities…) and 

3)       its ‘operations manual’ (e.g. how to monitor, backup, start-up and shut-down, list of software licences with suppliers names and expiration dates…)  

Hope that is helpful!
I am closing this. Most of this information has been supplied in a separate document some time ago. If any more information is needed a new ticket can be raised.

Jamie

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/get-ahead-school-leavers-programme/

vs.

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/get-ahead/

Arguably just 'Get ahead' would work better (short URLs and all that). The name of the folder won't affect the breadcrumb or navigation.

Another example:

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/get-ahead-apprentice-programme/faqs-for-the-school-leavers-programme/index.php

might be better as

http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/get-ahead/faqs/index.php

Short URLs are definitely better from a usability-and-copy-and-paste-into-email point of view.

And I believe I am right in saying that the breadcrumb and navigation comes from the file name not the folder name.

[apologies if this is more information than you need]

The point was not about the short URL, which will be /getahead; it's the
full one - as I said below, ideally it would have the words School
Leavers' rather than Apprentice

 

________________________________

Kieran, what do we usually do with these? Is it usual practice for us to change the folder name on the command line or to just move the files (about 10 of them) from within the UI? (which I guess would take all of 2 mins).

Done.

(although it is still quite good practice to keep URL paths short. See e.g. http://www.useit.com/alertbox/990321.html. The short URL "/getahead" will only cover the index page and not the other pages in the section)

Thanks Danny

 

Will certainly see what can be done about keeping URL paths shorter too

 

________________________________

Can the old folder be deleted pls, to keep it all neat?

 

ta

 

________________________________
Done

comments.value:
Afternoon you guys.

Would you still able to export the email addresses of everyone who voted in our Landmark London poll from last year?  If you can, we're considering contacting them this week.  Let me know if it's feasible ASAP?
Finn, I am just looking into this.
I believe this is possible. I have assigned this ticket to Jamie and marked it as pending. If you want the data this week, it would be very helpful if you could get back to us before Wednesday.

We'd like it tomorrow if there's any chance of that. Is that
reasonable?

 

________________________________
Jamie, is it reasonable? He means today!

How's this coming along you guys? Are we able to get this data shortly?

 

________________________________
set to 'urgent'.
This is taking a little longer than anticipated. We will have an update for you by mid-morning.

I'm checking this now
The getRelatedPages in the nav Package doesn't seem to return sorted results ~ could someone look at the function please?
Changed to high on Liz' request
effort estimate?

Have just emailed Lars:
  This seems to have been fixed.
  Or - at least - Liz's examples don't seem to exhibit the problem any more.
  Did you fix it? 
Am wondering though - perhaps it is just the "non-matching" related pages that exihibit this problem. (non-matching means "match a few tags" rather than "match all tags"). These might have dropped off the bottom of the list for some other reason.
Will investigate further once Lars has confirmed the above.

Briefly, Navigation.getRelatedPages() gets pages in the following order:
1. Any pages that match some or all of this page's tags & metadata, from the last 30 days, best match first.
2. Any pages that match some or all of this page's tags & metadata, from OUTSIDE of the last 30 days, best match first.
3. Any other pages, most recent first.

It only moves to 2, 3, if there are not enough results in 1.

My guess is that (2.) can - in some sicrumstances - return results that score high on relevance, but are very old.

If it's proved that this is the problem, then one possible solution would be to replace (2.) with:
2.1. Matching pages between 30 days and 1 year in age, best match first.
2.2. Matching pages older than 1 year, best match first.

Have implemented the above, with the following slight change:
Related pages are now found as follows:

1. Any pages that match some or all of this page's tags & metadata, from the last 30 days, best match first.
2.1. Matching pages between 30 days and 90 days, best match first.
2.2. Matching pages older than 90 days, ordered by most-recent postDate
3. Any other pages, ordered by most-recent postDate.

Could be paraphrased as:
1. Recent pages, most relevant first.
2.1. Fairly recent pages, most relevant first.
2.1. Older related pages, most recent first. 
3. Unrelated (but similar) pages, most recent first (only used in rare occasions where there's no other match).

Can you confirm that the following pages now show relavent recent-enough photos please?

  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/venues/olympic-stadium.php
  http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/venues/aquatics-centre.php

(remember that when previewing these pages in the cms, you can click on the image and it will give you an indication of why it was considered "related").

The truncated display names are a duplicate of (two or three) other tickets (which I'm moving on to next) so I think this ticket (pending the above) should be closed.
I think this is fine.  Alex, can you confirm you're happy?
Kieran: can you add your actual days to this and mark as solved. thanks.

Hi Alex,

Are you linking to the photo *page* or photo (image) itself ?

I wasn't trying to link to a photo at all, but a venue page. But the
photos pages seem to be coming up first (we had this issue a few months
ago which you fixed but it seems to have just gone back). Search should
bring up content pages first not photos...

 

________________________________

Hi Kieran,

Bit hard to see how we weight this in a sensible way (without hard coding, which I want to avoid as next week they complain that another page type should be coming up first) 

I guess the problem is that photo pages has better meta tags or title?

Any thoughts? bounce back to me and I'll happily explain why we can't do this.

thanks

Jamie

I have changed the weighting so that matches on /name/, especially /exact/ matches are now especially boosted. This seems to have fixed this particular problem. However, as is common with this sort of tweaking, there /might/ be results appearing elsewhere that someone might consider "oddly-ordered". I'm fairly confident, though, that there aren't any circumstances where boosting name-matches would cause a problem.
For reference, the Photo Page matches are all due to them being /tagged/ to "Olympic stadium".
Marking as solved.

comments.value:
The Webcams and Virtual tours are currently just loaded into pages based on latest first, this is largely because Virtual tours we're all of the park, based on month and therefore we assumed that latest tour was the most sensible. 

On the homepage and WebCam hub page we currently pull them in based on a 'navigation order' (I think you wnat to leave that as it stands). But, yes obviously where there is an associated webcam it makes sense to try and present this first on relevant venue page. 

We are proposing to change the behavior of both to work in a contextual fashion on the RHS promo where applicable (generic content or venue pages)

Jamie

Jamie, can you please not start work on this until I've gotten a better grip on what has been requested?

Thanks!

We can discuss next week if need be, but basically the webcams show the same camera on each of the venues pages which can't be changed (and basically throughout the website). I'm sure when the designs/wireframes were done this was the intention of these but it hasn't been done since launch.

Also it is really time consuming moving them round and having to change the navigation order in every webcam each time to want to re-prioritise them.

Alex

At the moment they both work by pulling in the latest webcams/tours we propose to change it so that they are pulled in based on matching 'venue' tags.
